main_definition: Windows refer to openings in a structure that allow light, air, or the ability to see outside. It is also an idiom representing various concepts depending on context.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Physical openings allowing natural light and fresh air into buildings
meanings_and_examples.example: The large windows in my living room let in plenty of sunlight during the day.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A point of opportunity or potential, often used metaphorically to discuss possibilities
meanings_and_examples.example: When considering a new job offer, there are many windows of opportunity you might explore.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Software interfaces that allow users to interact with data and applications
meanings_and_examples.example: The graphic design software has several windows where you can view different aspects of your project simultaneously.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A perspective or a way to see something, often used in discussions about viewpoints
meanings_and_examples.example: From the window seat on the plane, I had an unobstructed view of the landscape below.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Various opportunities or choices available for decision-making
meanings_and_examples.example: After completing my education, there were many career windows open to me that I could choose from.
